div.class: fsElement fsPostElement fsList featured-news fsThumbnailAlignLeft fsThumbnailSquare fsThumbnailMedium fsItemCount_5

div.a: Gov. Wolf: Reopening Targeted for May 8 in North-Central, Northwest

div.p: Governor Tom Wolf today presented his detailed plan for reopening the commonwealth with a targeted May 8 start. The administration will categorize reopening into three phases: red, yellow, green. Phases will be assigned based on conditions in a county, counties or region.

article.a: Read More About This Article about Gov. Wolf: Reopening Targeted for May 8 in North-Central, Northwest

div.p: All of Pennsylvania is under a stay-at-home order with travel restrictions and guidelines for maximum group gatherings through May 8, 2020. At this time, we cannot make any plans or promises for any end of the year and summer events, activities and gatherings. The only exceptions under consideration are commencement, prom and Extended School Year. For additional clarification, all 2019-2020 student events and travel are cancelled.

article.a: Read More About This Article about 2019-2020 school year update

div.p: The PENNCREST School District will continue to implement our Continuity of Education Plan. Planned instruction will occur online and/or in-home via deliverables or packets for our youngest students.

article.a: Read More About This Article about 2019-2020 School Closure

div.a: Student Meals & Continuity of Education Plan (CEP)

div.p: Thank you for your patience during the initial iPad and packet distribution. Monday we were able to distribute over 1200 iPads to our students. Student/parent pick up and drop off of printed materials will occur every Tuesday between 8:30 - 2:30pm in school vestibules. No one is permitted in our schools.
Our goal is to graduate students on June 5th and end the school year on June 9th. This is only possible if students continue with the online and in-home learning program with fidelity.

article.a: Read More About This Article about Student Meals & Continuity of Education Plan (CEP)

div.p: This plan has been created to support the diverse family situations that span o ur school district which geographically covers over 400 square miles with limited internet access. Providing continuity of education for students supports our mission to provide resources and opportunities that challenge students, assess their educational progress, provide a system of support and empower all to become confident lifelong learners.

article.a: Read More About This Article about Continuity of Education Plan: March 30, 2020
